intro: Aspidium corazonense, commonly known as the Corazón fern, is a species of fern native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Aspidium corazonense plays a vital role in its ecosystem by contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
